title: First job after leaving school (c.1916)
brief_description: Interviewee Nin Martin from Goldsborough (near Dunolly) talks about his first job as a young lad in 1916 working for a mining company and how he, along with other young boys, used only a hammer to crush open the stones of quartz mined by the older diggers, in order to find the layer of molybdenum which was needed to strengthen the steel in the making of munitions for the war.
